issue.title: [CF 767] Add Custom Timer to Buff/Debuff
issue.body:
Would it be possible to add a custom, user-set timer to a Buff/Debuff? Some things I (and others) might want to track do not have durations, and are therefore slightly untrackable.

For example, I just obtained the Fabled Feather of Ji-Kun tonight, and the stacking buff that is applied via the proc has no timer. If I try tracking it via Combat Event, it won't show the stacks due to it only tracking the aura being applied, and nothing thereafter.

To answer a followup, yes I CAN track the "Feathers of Fury" buff, but that won't show me the stacks that "Mighty" has, which I'd like to be able to see.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jastain | Imported from CurseForge issue #767 | Raw

comments.body:
You can always create two icons - one that will be used to get the timing information, and another that will be used to get the stack information.

Set the [Stacks] tag on the icon that is used for the timing information to refer to the icon that gets the stack information. E.g. [Stacks(group=1,icon=2)]. Set the icon used for the stacks to Always Hide.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Oh wow. I never even knew I could do that. I should probably take an afternoon to look more in depth on the dogtags I could play around with, but this is definitely eye opening.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jastain
